purpleculture_pinyin:
jì
to continue; to follow after; to go on with; to succeed; to inherit; then; afterwards
продолжить; следовать за; продолжать; преуспеть; наследовать; тогда; после
rtega_mnemonic:
繼繼RS
继继		継continue, maintain, carry on, inherit
  • one thread 糸 apart from other threads with knife 㡭 that will not be cut: continues
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 继)
Pictophonetic: 㡭 indicates the sound; 糹 (thread) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
繼續 [ jì xù ]: to continue; to proceed with; to go on with
繼承 [ jì chéng ]: to inherit; to succeed to (the throne etc); to carry on (a tradition etc)
繼而 [ jì ér ]: then; afterwards
繼往開來 [ jì wǎng kāi lái ]: to follow the past and herald the future (idiom); part of a historical transition; forming a bridge between earlier and later stages
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 糹 [ sī ] silk; thread
    • 㡭 [ jì ] to continue; to carry on; to succeed, to inherit
heisig_chinese_memo: Spiderman is lost in the mountains without food and can't carry on much longer, but it's his lucky day and he finds four cocoons to munch on.
Ru_trainchinese: jì: (глаг/союз) наследовать, сменять (напр., на посту); продолжать, следовать; затем, потом
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Spidey is hooked on rice because it's the only thing he inherited from his Uncle Ben.  This is how he can carry on his legacy.
humanum_full_description_en:
Bronze inscriptions are not from "糸", from " 𢆶 " from "一" from "幺" to two dashes . The two dashes are provincial symbols, which means it is the provincial script of " 𢆶 ". He Linyi believes that his image is connected with four pieces, so it has the meaning of continuity and continuity. Jin Wen said to continue, and Patton: "Stepmother (Wu) 圼 (㘿), use sacrifice", said to continue the sacrifice, not to stop.

"Said the text": "Continue, continue. From Shima. One said anti-𢇍 to continue."
humanum_short_description_en: Synopsis: The " following " in bronze inscription is like four " shito " (" silk ") connected, so it means continuity and continuity.
humanum_full_description:
金文不從「糸」，從「𢆶」從「一」從「幺」從兩短橫，兩短橫是省文符號，表示是「𢆶」的省文。何琳儀認為其形象四糸相連，故有繼續、連續之意。金文表示繼續，拍敦：「繼母(毋)圼(㘿)，用祀」，表示延續祭祀，不要斷絕。

　　《說文》：「繼，續也。从糸㡭。一曰反𢇍為繼。」
humanum_short_description: 金文「繼」象四「糸」（「絲」）相連，故有繼續、連續之意。

繼 (Simplified: 继)
Pinyin: jì
English Definition: to continue; to follow after; to go on with; to succeed; to inherit; then; afterwards
Total strokes: 20; Radical: 糸
Pictophonetic: 㡭 indicates the sound; 糹 (thread) conveys the meaning.
Character Formation:
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 糹 [ sī ] silk; thread
    • 㡭 [ jì ] to continue; to carry on; to succeed, to inherit
Example Words:
繼續 [ jì xù ]: to continue; to proceed with; to go on with
繼承 [ jì chéng ]: to inherit; to succeed to (the throne etc); to carry on (a tradition etc)
繼而 [ jì ér ]: then; afterwards
繼往開來 [ jì wǎng kāi lái ]: to follow the past and herald the future (idiom); part of a historical transition; forming a bridge between earlier and later stages

金文不從「 糸 」，從「 𢆶 」從「 一 」從「 幺 」從兩短橫，兩短橫是省文符號，表示是「 𢆶 」的省文。何琳儀認為其形象四糸相連，故有繼續、連續之意。金文表示繼續，拍敦：「繼母(毋)圼(㘿)，用祀」，表示延續祭祀，不要斷絕。 《說文》：「繼，續也。从糸㡭。一曰反𢇍為繼。」
Bronze inscriptions are not from " 糸", from " 𢆶" from " 一" from " 幺" to two dashes. The two dashes are provincial symbols, which means it is the provincial script of " 𢆶". He Linyi believes that his image is connected with four pieces, so it has the meaning of continuity and continuity. Jin Wen said to continue, and Patton: "Stepmother (Wu) 圼 (㘿), use sacrifice", said to continue the sacrifice, not to stop. "Said the text": "Continue, continue. From Shima. One said anti-𢇍 to continue."

繼字的基本解释

繼
jì
见“继”。

繼字的汉语字典释义

[①]［jì］
［《廣韻》古詣切，去霽，見。］
“继1”的繁体字。亦作“継1”。
(1)延续；使之不绝。
(2)前后相续；接连不断。
(3)随后；跟着。
(4)承接。
(5)增益；接济。
(6)系。系念。

繼字的康熙字典解释

【未集中】【糸字部】　繼； 康熙笔画：20； 页码：页941第34
【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?古詣切，音計。【說文】續也。【玉篇】紹繼也。【易·繫辭】繼之者，善也。【中庸】善繼人之志。【孟子】爲可繼也。【五經文字】繼从㡭，反?爲㡭。俗作継，非。　又【集韻】吉棄切，音繫。縛也。【後漢·李固傳】羣下繼望。【註】劉攽曰：繼是繼續之義，不可施於此。蓋本是繫字，繫綴天下之望也。○按繼又音繫，訓縛，卽繫之義。劉欲改繼爲繫，非是。

繼字的源字形

[①]［jì］
["Guangyun" ancient legends cut, go to Ji, see. ]
Traditional characters for "继1". Also known as "継1".
(1) Continue; make it inexhaustible.
(2) One after another; one after another.
(3) Then; follow.
(4) To undertake.
(5) Gain; aid.
(6) Department. Department of thought.
